thread.title: I'm a very erratic dresser: Athiya Shetty
thread.title_full: I'm a very erratic dresser: Athiya Shetty | Latest News & Updates at Daily News & Analysis

author: dna     | From the print edition
title: I'm a very erratic dresser: Athiya Shetty
text:
She's easily entrenched a firm position in fashion's elusive landscape. She poses like a pro and rocks any couture outfit under the sun with a confidence of a supermodel. Biker chic, preppy, grunge or vintage - give her any look and she's likely to do full justice to it. After Hrs speaks to the Hero actress on her love for all things chic and cool...
Being fashion's it girl...
I don't know if I'm the 'it' girl but it's a nice feeling that everyone thinks I'm confident. I'm happy and excited. I'm having a lot of fun - whether it goes right or wrong, I don't know. I think that what matters. I always wanted to be an actress since young but I wasn't vocal about it. Acting's always been I have loved and enjoyed doing.
What does your name mean...
Gift of God.
Style icon.
Kendall Jenner.
Sari or LBD
I love Indian so sari.
Cheek bones or long limbs
Cheek bones.
Sooraj Pancholi or Salman Khan
Sooraj Pancholi.
One product endorsement I'd never do.
Fairness cream.
Biggest competition? Also, comment about comparisons with Sonam Kapoor.
There's only one Sonam Kapoor and no one can ever reach close enough to her. She's in a league of her own. She's one of the elegant and classy actresses of today's times. There's no room for comparisons because she's quite ahead.
Favourite labels
Sabyasachi and Givenchy. I'm more of a high street shopper so I love Topshop, Bershka and Pull & Bear.
Styling inputs
I like to be comfortable in what I wear. It has to suit your body type.
Personal style
Boho chic right now. I'm a very erratic dresser - one day I'd be in track pants with ganjee, next day I'd be girlie. It depends on my mood.
Accessories love.
I'm minimalistic. I don't like neck-pieces. I stack up my wrist with watches and bracelets.
How often you shop.
Whenever I travel.
Vintage finds.
Recently, I found my mom's denim jacket which she used to wear in college and her round glasses, my nani's gold hoops and bracelets.
Mom Mana's style influence.
Growing up, I have always seen her put things together well whether it's a plain white shirt with silver jewellery.
Decade in fashion you want to go back to,
70's bell bottoms.
Fashion capital
Paris.
Share a style tip
It's okay to make mistakes.
Any faux pas you think Indian women commit and should avoid?
Who am I to judge? I make mistakes constantly.
